a0TE00000000ZowMAE.name: Repertorio Español
a0TE00000000ZowMAE.detail:
PARKING: Is available at ICON Parking located on 29th Street between Lexington and Third Avenues. Almost corner of Third Avenue on the North Side of the street. 4 hours for $10. Make sure to validate your ticket at our box office to receive this special rate. 

SUBWAYS: 6 Train to 28th Street (approx 2 blocks away); N,R to 28th Street (approx 5 blocks away). 

BUSES: At 34th Street: M34 or M16 to Lexington Avenue. At 23rd Street: M23 to Lexington Avenue
a0TE00000000ZowMAE.address:
138 East 27th Street New York, NY 10016
Between Lexington and Third Avenues

events.detail: By JUan Claudio Lechín | Directed by Leyma López
events.description:
The hysterical, critically acclaimed comedy that follows the adventures of a dictator well past his prime and those sent to kill him off.

“The old bird is understandably confused. When he was a boy, Havana was sometimes called the Paris of the Caribbean. He thought he had put an end to that capitalist decadence, but now that he’s in his late 80s, some guy is suddenly trying to open Cuba back up again. And the guy is black.” – The New York Times

events.description:
The latest one-man-show by Spanish language comedian, Saulo García.

A new and hilarious stand-up comedy by the same gifted comedian who made us laugh uncontrollably with “La vida en los Esclavos Unidos” and “El insomnia americano.” “En la USA me quedé” is a non-stop over the top comedy about the life of immigrants who decide to stay in the USA searching for the American Dream which will ultimately come true for their children.

events.description:
Gossip and ageism nip at the marriage of a mismatched couple in Federico García Lorca’s rarely produced comedy.

“A humorous, but thoughtful look at the antagonistic relationship between a young wife and her 53 year-old shoemaker husband […] It doesn’t help that the town’s gossips are always sniping at her, or that the mayor is making advances, all rendered in a comic style[.] So when her husband makes a radical decision that will change their lives, she’s forced to rely on her wits.” – The Huffington Post

events.description:
An over-the-top comedy about the whims and pretentions of a family desperate to climb the social ladder.

“‘La nena se casa’ is a rip-roaring look at Puerto Rican idiosyncrasies while highlighting deeply universal themes.” – LatinTRENDS

Performed in Spanish with subtitles in English & Spanish via Simultext® In-Seat Captioning System.

events.detail: By Caridad Svich | Directed by José Zayas
events.description:
Gabriel García Márquez’s epic tale in which a secret love must stand the test of time.

“Fifty-one years, nine months and four days I have waited for you,” Florentino Ariza tells Fermina Daza when he arrives after her husband’s death, approaching her with ‘the faltering steps of age’ Mr. García Márquez describes in his book. Their interrupted courtship bookends the narrative, which is set, Ms. Svich’s script informs us, in the ‘present, past and future.’” – The New York Times

events.description:
An on-stage masterpiece that brings to life a struggling, tight knit family in pre-revolutionary Cuba.

"I'm going to marry the first man I find in the street!" yells Luz Marina, the protagonist of Virgilio Piñera's greatest play, “Aire frío.” A strong -willed fighter bent on survival in a harsh world of male chauvinism, necessity and political turmoil, she will toil to keep her family together while chasing her own humble dream of finding a husband.

events.detail: By Mario Diament | Directed by Jorge Alí Triana
events.description:
An on-stage thriller that dives deep into a twisted world of encounters, passion and murder.

Performed around the world to enthusiastic critical and audience acclaim, “Cita a ciegas” is a compelling and riveting play about chance encounters. An intricate puzzle of passions, destinies, and coincidences seduces audiences into a world filled with unrequited love, dangerous obsessions, and the thought of what-might-have-been.

events.detail: By Caridad Svich | Directed by José Zayas
events.description:
The Mirabal sisters stood up to one of history’s most notorious dictators, and this on-stage adaptation brings these national heroines back to life.

“The outrage and sorrow that greeted the murder of the three elegant and revolutionary Mirabal sisters in the Dominican Republic during the homicidal dictatorship of General Rafael Trujillo have never really ended. These emotions are evident […] and is the subject of ‘In the Time of the Butterflies.’ […] it largely does justice to this story of injustice.” –Backstage

events.detail: By Carmen Rivera | Directed by René Buch
events.description:
Carmen Rivera’s iconic play that captures the spirit of the Puerto Rican experience.

“‘La gringa’ is the story of a young woman from New York who goes to Puerto Rico in search of her extended family. When she finds them, the complicated misperceptions that develop on all sides unfold in comic dialogue that arouses constant shouts of laughter and bursts of applause […]” – The New York Times

events.description:
A journey to the Colombia of Gabriel García Márquez that explores the grisly murder of an innocent man and the guilt of an entire village.

“[‘Crónica de una muerte anunciada’] was based on an actual murder that came to fascinate journalists bent on interviewing the crime's plethora of colorful witnesses. Bogotá-based director Jorge Alí Triana— who adapted the work— deploys an array of relatives, friends, and townspeople struggling to explain how the Vicario twins killed Santiago Nasar for deflowering their sister, Angela. The flashbacks and mesmerizing chatter elicit the same gallows humor that festers in newsrooms from New York to Tierra del Fuego, and the absurdity of crimes of passion is laid bare.” – The Village Voice

events.description:
Federico García Lorca’s prolific tragedy that unfolds in a cloistered world of women in 1930s Spain.

“Hatred, jealousy and despair come to life, almost as characters in their own right, in the Repertorio Español’s Spanish-language production of ‘La casa de Bernarda Alba.’ […] García Lorca’s grim satisfaction in exposing the pretensions, self-deceits and destructive willfulness of Bernarda Alba and her five daughters in a world of women who are all victims is almost palpable.” – The New York Times

events.detail: Directed by Jorge Alí Triana
events.description:
An adaptation of Miguel de Cervantes’ epic novel that follows the misadventures of Don Quijote and his loyal squire, Sancho Panza.

“‘El Quijote’ stresses the absurdities of Don Quijote’s quest, as he attempts to right wrongs and rescue damsels in distress […] Don Quijote and Sancho stumble through a series of adventures (or misadventures, as Sancho calls them). Company members never falter, never miss a step. At the same time, the director’s creativity is unbounded.” – Backstage

events.detail: By Jorge Amado | Directed by Jorge Alí Triana
events.description:
A bawdy farce in the streets of Bahía, Brazil brought to life with soap-opera star Francisco Gattorno.

“This adaptation of Jorge Amado’s Brazilian novel […] is a sex farce with the clarity and logic of a folk tale. […] The widow Flor marries Teodoro, a staid pharmacist, only to have her philandering, gambling bad-boy of a first husband, Vadinho, return from the dead.” –The New York Times

events.detail: Musical Direction by Pablo Zinger | Stage Direction by José Zayas
events.description:
A musical review of the musical contributions of Latina composers to the music of Latin America.

A new concert celebrating the musical contributions of female Latin American composers María Grever (Júrame, Alma mía); Consuelo Velázquez (Bésame mucho, Cachito); Violeta Parra (Gracias a la vida); Chabuca Granda (Fina estampa, La flor de la canela); Margarita Lecuona (Babalú); Isolina Carrillo (Dos gardenias para ti); María Elena Walsh (Manuelita la tortuga); Sylvia Rexach (Olas y arena, Di corazón) and many more; performed by extraordinary singers with live music.

events.description:
A powerhouse performance by the rising international star of Flamenco dance, Olga Pericet.

“Who is Olga Pericet? In ‘Flamenco sin título’ (Flamenco Untitled), at Repertorio Español, the answer keeps changing. Joined by three other performers – the guitarist Antonia Jiménez and the singers José Ángel Carmona and Ismael Fernández – on the Repertorio’s small stage, Ms. Pericet, a compact powerhouse of a dancer, passes through many moods and modes of performance.” – Siobhan Burke, The New York Times

events.detail: By Cristóbal de Virués | Directed by Diego M. Chiri
events.description:
In her search for absolute power, Queen Semíramis will awake a web of passions, secrets and betrayals which she will use as weapons in order to challenge the wheel of fortune.

Discover this almost unknown theatrical gem, one of the pioneers of the horror genre from the Spanish Golden Age and performed for the first time in the American stage.

Performed in Spanish with subtitles in English & Spanish via Simultext® In-Seat Captioning System.

events.detail: Directed by Luis Fernández | Starring Mimí Lazo
events.description:
A new stand-up comedy show by Mimí Lazo.

Maríta is determined to do what it takes to protect her marriage, along with the comfortable social status that goes with it. Along with her overbearing mother whose beliefs are from another era, she will go to any length to make sure she remains lady of the house.

events.detail:
Based on Mario Vargas Llosa's novel 

By Caridad Svich | Directed by José Zayas
events.description: When 18-year-old aspiring writer Mario falls in love with his aunt-in-law, he dives headfirst into a world of wild passion and forbidden love that will scandalize and entertain the “novela” and radio soap operas obsessed world of 1950s Lima, Peru. Based on the autobiographical tale of Nobel Prize winning writer, Mario Vargas Llosa and adapted for the stage by OBIE award winning playwright Caridad Svich.

events.detail: Directed by Bobby Comedia | Starring Ana María Simón | Music by Rafael "Pollo" Brito
events.description: A microphone, a bench, a spotlight, and a tale that spans the nine months up to a birth - that's the setting where Ana María Simon, the Venezuelan actress and TV personality, performs her first stand-up comedy show, "Soy de pura madre."
